Description: Inlay element in the form of a lotus-flower incorporating glazed composition leaves of green, and flowers made from a combination of red, light blue and dark blue elements.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, The North Suburb, Large Estates, House U.37.22.
Curator's comments: Published: Frankfort and Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten II (London, 1933), 21, pl. XXX, fig.3.

Colourful faience inlays and tiles were a feature of house, temple and palace decoration at Tell el-Amarna. See, for example: Fairman, City of Akhenaten II (London, 1933): pl.30 Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III (London, 1951): pls.62, 72 Pharaohs of the Sun (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1999): 228
Exhibition history: 2012 7 December - 13 April 2013, Berlin, Neues Museum, In the Light of Amarna
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 26/386 (Egypt Exploration Society excavation number)
